SEARCH
Package it.polimi.ingsw.controller

Class LobbyController

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.controller.LobbyController
All Implemented Interfaces:
LobbyControllerInterface, OnServerConnectionLostListener
public class LobbyController extends Object implements OnServerConnectionLostListener, LobbyControllerInterface

This class is used to assign every user that wants to play MyShelfie game inside a different match.

More specifically, it handles different situation:

  • The user wants to join an existing match
  • The user tries to create a new game
  • The user has been disconnected
  • After connection lost a user is trying to reconnecting to a game
  • Verify if a user is still connected
  • A match has finished so players can join or create new match

Since:
26/04/2023
Version:
4.0
Author:
Tommaso Trabacchin, Melanie Tonarelli, Emanuele Valsecchi, Adem Shehi

  • Field Details

    • controllerViewMap

      private final Map<Controller,List<ClientInterface>> controllerViewMap

      Holds a match between different controllers and all the users that are assigned to that controller.

      This fields is used to retrieve all the users at once that are assigned to a specific controller (that is used as a "key")

    • viewControllerMap

      private final Map<ClientInterface,Controller> viewControllerMap

      Holds a match between a user and the corresponding controller that is handling the game in which he is assigned

      This fields is used to retrieve faster the controller given a specific user (that is used as "key")

    • waitingUsers

      private final List<ClientInterface> waitingUsers
      Holds all users that are not assigned to a game match

    • viewToNicknameMap

      private final Map<ClientInterface,String> viewToNicknameMap

      Holds a match between a user and it's nickname.

      This field is useful when a new client tries to join or create a new game match but the nickname that is using is already taken by someone else

      The client associated to a particular nickname is obtained using this last as a unique ("key") value

      See Also:
      • Player

    • setDispatcher

      public void setDispatcher(ControllerDispatcher dispatcher)
      Binds a dispatcher instance to the calling object

    • joinGame

      public void joinGame(ClientInterface user, String nickname) throws AlreadyTakenNicknameException, AlreadyInGameException

      This method handles a user's request to join a match.

      More precisely, it uses a "user interface" and a nickname to check if the nickname was already taken by someone; based on this two values:

      • If the nickname has never been used by a client the user is added to the game without problems
      • If the nickname was already taken by someone:
        • The player with that nickname is reconnected to the game if and only if the player was disconnected
        • An error occurs if the nickname was already taken by someone and the player is still connected or the player is not assigned to a game but the name was already chosen by someone

      Specified by:
      joinGame in interface LobbyControllerInterface
      Parameters:
      user - instance of a client that wants to join a game
      nickname - the nickname of the client that is trying to connect at a match
      Throws:
      AlreadyTakenNicknameException - if someone already took the nickname
      AlreadyInGameException - if a player with the same nickname is assigned to a match that is still running
      See Also:
      • Player

    • createGame

      public void createGame(ClientInterface user, String nickname, int numberOfPlayer) throws AlreadyTakenNicknameException, AlreadyInGameException, FileNotFoundException, WrongNumberOfPlayersException, URISyntaxException

      This method handles a user's request to create a game.

      More precisely, it uses a "user interface", a nickname and a integer value to check if the nickname was already taken by someone or the max number of player for that game is already reached. Based on this three values:

      • If the nickname has never been used by a client the client can create a new game
      • If the nickname was already taken by someone the client can't create a game if the match in which it was assigned is still running

      Specified by:
      createGame in interface LobbyControllerInterface
      Parameters:
      user - instance of a client that wants to create a game
      nickname - the nickname of the client that is trying to create a game
      numberOfPlayer - the max number of player that can join the game
      Throws:
      AlreadyTakenNicknameException - if someone already took the nickname
      AlreadyInGameException - if a player with the same nickname is assigned to a match that is still running
      FileNotFoundException - if a file that is requested to build the game is not found
      WrongNumberOfPlayersException
      URISyntaxException
      See Also:
      • ClientInterface
      • Player
      • State
      • AlreadyTakenNicknameException
      • AlreadyInGameException
      • FileNotFoundException

    • nop

      public void nop()

      Specified by:

    • onEndGame

      public void onEndGame(Controller controller)

      This method is used to clean every bind between

      • a client and a controller
      • dispatcher and a controller

      Parameters:
      controller - the controller of the game that is finished

    • firstGameAvailable

      private Controller firstGameAvailable()

      This method retrieve the first controller that is bound to a game with available spaces for player

      Returns:
      • first controller instance that has a game with available spaces for player.
      • null if there is no game with available player "position"

    • onConnectionLost

      public void onConnectionLost(ClientInterface user)
      Defines the action to be performed when a client lost the connection to the server.

      In that case if the player was assigned to a game that is still running the player state is set to "disconnected" and the client is added to a "disconnected player list" until he connects again.

      In addition if the player was in the "waiting list" to play in a match is removed from this one

      Specified by:
      onConnectionLost in interface OnServerConnectionLostListener
      Parameters:
      user - the user which has lost the connection
      See Also:
      • Controller.onConnectionLost(ClientInterface client)
      • PlayerState
      • Player.setPlayerState(PlayerState playerState)

    • onQuitGame

      public void onQuitGame(ClientInterface user)

      This method removes the binding between each user and the corresponding controller of the game in which the client was assigned.

      Parameters:
      user - the client to be removed from the correspondences
      See Also:
      • viewToNicknameMap

    • addPlayerToGame

      private void addPlayerToGame(ClientInterface user, String nickname)

      This method adds a new player to an existing game.

      More specifically if:

      • there aren't match in which the player can be assigned, the user is insert in a waiting list.
      • there is an available match, the player is assigned to that and the correct correspondences are created

      Parameters:
      user - the client that needs to be added
      nickname - the player nickname with which the client wants to register in a match
      See Also:
      • viewToNicknameMap
      • nicknameToViewMap
      • controllerViewMap
      • viewControllerMap
      • dispatcher
      • State
      • Player

    • reconnectPlayer

      private void reconnectPlayer(ClientInterface user, String nickname)

      This method handles the reconnection of a player to an existing game match.

      Parameters:
      user - the client that reconnect to a match
      nickname - the player nickname with which the client wants to re-join in a match

    • createNewGame

      private void createNewGame(ClientInterface user, String nickname, int numberOfPlayer) throws FileNotFoundException, URISyntaxException

      This method is used to create a new game match and create bindings between:

      • the client that is creating a new game match
      • the controller that will manage the game match
      • waiting usersthat will be assigned to tne new game match

      Parameters:
      user - the client that is creating a new game match
      nickname - the player nickname that is creating the match
      numberOfPlayer - the max number of player that can join the game
      Throws:
      FileNotFoundException - if a file that is requested to build the game is not found
      URISyntaxException
      See Also:
      • Controller
      • Controller.registerPlayer(ClientInterface user, String nickname)
      • Controller.setNumberPlayers(int numberOfPlayer)
